verses.verse: My son, <S%H1121><s%> if <S%H518><s%> thou be surety <S%H6148><s%> for thy friend, <S%H7453><s%> if thou hast stricken <S%H8628><s%> thy hand <S%H3709><s%> with a stranger, <S%H2114><s%>
Thou art snared <S%H3369><s%> with the words <S%H561><s%> of thy mouth, <S%H6310><s%> thou art taken <S%H3920><s%> with the words <S%H561><s%> of thy mouth. <S%H6310><s%>

Do <S%H6213><s%> this <S%H2063><s%> now, <S%H645><s%> my son, <S%H1121><s%> and deliver thyself, <S%H5337><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> thou art come <S%H935><s%> into the hand <S%H3709><s%> of thy friend; <S%H7453><s%> go, <S%H1980><s%> humble thyself, <S%H7511><s%> and make sure <S%H7292><s%> thy friend. <S%H7453><s%>
Give <S%H5414><s%> not <S%H408><s%> sleep <S%H8142><s%> to thine eyes, <S%H5869><s%> nor slumber <S%H8572><s%> to thine eyelids. <S%H6079><s%>

Deliver thyself <S%H5337><s%> as a roe <S%H6643><s%> from the hand <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3027><s%> of the hunter, and as a bird <S%H6833><s%> from the hand <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3027><s%> of the fowler. <S%H3353><s%>
Go <S%H1980><s%> to <S%H413><s%> the ant, <S%H5244><s%> thou sluggard; <S%H6102><s%> consider <S%H7200><s%> her ways, <S%H1870><s%> and be wise: <S%H2449><s%>
Which <S%H834><s%> having no <S%H369><s%> guide, <S%H7101><s%> overseer, <S%H7860><s%> or ruler, <S%H4910><s%>
Provideth <S%H3559><s%> her meat <S%H3899><s%> in the summer, <S%H7019><s%> and gathereth <S%H103><s%> her food <S%H3978><s%> in the harvest. <S%H7105><s%>
How long <S%H5704><s%> <S%H4970><s%> wilt thou sleep, <S%H7901><s%> O sluggard? <S%H6102><s%> when <S%H4970><s%> wilt thou arise <S%H6965><s%> out of thy sleep? <S%H4480><s%> <S%H8142><s%>
Yet a little <S%H4592><s%> sleep, <S%H8142><s%> a little <S%H4592><s%> slumber, <S%H8572><s%> a little <S%H4592><s%> folding <S%H2264><s%> of the hands <S%H3027><s%> to sleep: <S%H7901><s%>
So shall thy poverty <S%H7389><s%> come <S%H935><s%> as one that traveleth, <S%H1980><s%> and thy want <S%H4270><s%> as an armed <S%H4043><s%> man. <S%H376><s%>
A naughty <S%H1100><s%> person, <S%H120><s%> a wicked <S%H205><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> walketh <S%H1980><s%> with a froward <S%H6143><s%> mouth. <S%H6310><s%>
He winketh <S%H7169><s%> with his eyes, <S%H5869><s%> he speaketh <S%H4448><s%> with his feet, <S%H7272><s%> he teacheth <S%H3384><s%> with his fingers; <S%H676><s%>
Frowardness <S%H8419><s%> is in his heart, <S%H3820><s%> he deviseth <S%H2790><s%> mischief <S%H7451><s%> continually; <S%H3605><s%> <S%H6256><s%> he soweth <S%H7971><s%> discord. <S%H4066><s%>

Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> shall his calamity <S%H343><s%> come <S%H935><s%> suddenly; <S%H6597><s%> suddenly <S%H6621><s%> shall he be broken <S%H7665><s%> without <S%H369><s%> remedy. <S%H4832><s%>
These <S%H2007><s%> six <S%H8337><s%> things doth the LORD <S%H3068><s%> hate: <S%H8130><s%> yea, seven <S%H7651><s%> are an abomination <S%H8441><s%> unto him: <S%H5315><s%>
A proud <S%H7311><s%> look, <S%H5869><s%> a lying <S%H8267><s%> tongue, <S%H3956><s%> and hands <S%H3027><s%> that shed <S%H8210><s%> innocent <S%H5355><s%> blood, <S%H1818><s%>
A heart <S%H3820><s%> that deviseth <S%H2790><s%> wicked <S%H205><s%> imaginations, <S%H4284><s%> feet <S%H7272><s%> that be swift <S%H4116><s%> in running <S%H7323><s%> to mischief, <S%H7451><s%>
A false <S%H8267><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> that speaketh <S%H6315><s%> lies, <S%H3577><s%> and he that soweth <S%H7971><s%> discord <S%H4090><s%> among <S%H996><s%> brethren. <S%H251><s%>
My son, <S%H1121><s%> keep <S%H5341><s%> thy father's <S%H1><s%> commandment, <S%H4687><s%> and forsake <S%H5203><s%> not <S%H408><s%> the law <S%H8451><s%> of thy mother: <S%H517><s%>
Bind <S%H7194><s%> them continually <S%H8548><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> thine heart, <S%H3820><s%> and tie <S%H6029><s%> them about <S%H5921><s%> thy neck. <S%H1621><s%>

When thou goest, <S%H1980><s%> it shall lead <S%H5148><s%> thee; <S%H853><s%> when thou sleepest, <S%H7901><s%> it shall keep <S%H8104><s%> <S%H5921><s%> thee; and when thou awakest, <S%H6974><s%> it <S%H1931><s%> shall talk <S%H7878><s%> with thee.

For <S%H3588><s%> the commandment <S%H4687><s%> is a lamp; <S%H5216><s%> and the law <S%H8451><s%> is light; <S%H216><s%> and reproofs <S%H8433><s%> of instruction <S%H4148><s%> are the way <S%H1870><s%> of life: <S%H2416><s%>
To keep <S%H8104><s%> thee from the evil <S%H7451><s%> woman, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H802><s%> from the flattery <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2513><s%> of the tongue <S%H3956><s%> of a strange woman. <S%H5237><s%>
Lust <S%H2530><s%> not <S%H408><s%> after her beauty <S%H3308><s%> in thine heart; <S%H3824><s%> neither <S%H408><s%> let her take <S%H3947><s%> thee with her eyelids. <S%H6079><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> by means <S%H1157><s%> of a whorish <S%H2181><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> a man is brought to <S%H5704><s%> a piece <S%H3603><s%> of bread: <S%H3899><s%> and the adulteress <S%H802><s%> <S%H376><s%> will hunt <S%H6679><s%> for the precious <S%H3368><s%> life. <S%H5315><s%>
Can a man <S%H376><s%> take <S%H2846><s%> fire <S%H784><s%> in his bosom, <S%H2436><s%> and his clothes <S%H899><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> be burned? <S%H8313><s%>
Can <S%H518><s%> one <S%H376><s%> go <S%H1980><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> hot coals, <S%H1513><s%> and his feet <S%H7272><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> be burned? <S%H3554><s%>

So <S%H3651><s%> he that goeth in <S%H935><s%> to <S%H413><s%> his neighbor's <S%H7453><s%> wife; <S%H802><s%> whosoever <S%H3605><s%> toucheth <S%H5060><s%> her shall not <S%H3808><s%> be innocent. <S%H5352><s%>

Men do not <S%H3808><s%> despise <S%H936><s%> a thief, <S%H1590><s%> if <S%H3588><s%> he steal <S%H1589><s%> to satisfy <S%H4390><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> he is hungry; <S%H7456><s%>

But if he be found, <S%H4672><s%> he shall restore <S%H7999><s%> sevenfold; <S%H7659><s%> he shall give <S%H5414><s%> <S%H853><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the substance <S%H1952><s%> of his house. <S%H1004><s%>

But whoso committeth adultery <S%H5003><s%> with a woman <S%H802><s%> lacketh <S%H2638><s%> understanding: <S%H3820><s%> he <S%H1931><s%> that doeth <S%H6213><s%> it destroyeth <S%H7843><s%> his own soul. <S%H5315><s%>
A wound <S%H5061><s%> and dishonor <S%H7036><s%> shall he get; <S%H4672><s%> and his reproach <S%H2781><s%> shall not <S%H3808><s%> be wiped away. <S%H4229><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> jealousy <S%H7068><s%> is the rage <S%H2534><s%> of a man: <S%H1397><s%> therefore he will not <S%H3808><s%> spare <S%H2550><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of vengeance. <S%H5359><s%>

He will not <S%H3808><s%> regard <S%H6440><s%> <S%H5375><s%> any <S%H3605><s%> ransom; <S%H3724><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> will he rest content, <S%H14><s%> though <S%H3588><s%> thou givest many <S%H7235><s%> gifts. <S%H7810><s%>
